resources.string: Share non-identifying data about your fill ups and help build a community database of information about each model of vehicle.
Share non-identifying data that can help us understand how the app is used and to quickly receive crash reports.
It looks like you don\'t have any vehicles set up yet.
Touch that \"Settings\" button down there. When you get to the Settings screen, touch \"My Vehicles\", then \"Add A Vehicle\". Once you\'ve set up a vehicle or two you can begin tracking!
It looks like you haven\'t logged any fill-ups yet.
Once you have logged a fill-up, your most recent MPG will show up in this space. For now, touch that big \"Log A Fill-Up\" button down there the next time you stop at the gas station.
Since there are 8 furlongs in a mile, and 8 pints in a gallon, your car gets the same furlongs-per-pint as it gets miles-per-gallon.
There was an error saving your vehicle. Please check your data and try again.
Sorry, there are no results for the selected year.
Sorry, there are no results for the year and make you selected.
Are you sure you want to delete this vehicle?
There was an error deleting your vehicle. Please try again.
Please input valid entries for miles and gallons.
You must have at least one vehicle saved. Please set up a vehicle and come back when you\'re done
You have not logged any fill-ups for this vehicle. Do you want to enter some information?

Android MPG Tracker is a simple application that helps you keep track of your gas mileage over time and see your trend over time.

Step One: 
Use the Settings Screen to set up your vehicle profiles. Touch My Vehicles, then Add A Vehicle. Use the dropdowns to select your car's year, make, model and trim. Set up as many vehicles as you plan to drive regularly.

Step Two: 
Track your mileage. If you're tracking your mileage we know you're already diligent about resetting your trip odometer and putting the mileage and fill-up through your phone's calculator. Just keep doing that but instead select Track a Fill-Up from the main screen, select your car from the dropdown and input the data.

Step Three: 
See how your last tank compares to previous tanks. Over time we will continue to collect data from other drivers of the same vehicle, and as that data builds up you will be able to compare your performance to the community as a whole.

(Data behind vehicle selection is provided by Edmunds)
Checking for existing data from another installation of MPG Tracker
Transferring existing data from another installation of MPG Tracker
